description.narrative: A child sensitive national social protection strategy is endorsed with coordinated support to strengthened Government institutional framework for knowledge management, implementation and monitoring, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social protection programmes and systems respond effectively to the rights of the poorest and most vulnerable children and their families, complemented by quality social welfare services.

title.narrative: A child sensitive national social protection strategy is endorsed with coordinated support to strengthened Governmentinstitutional framework for knowledge management, implementation and monitoring

description.narrative: The child sensitive social protection strategy (ENSSB II 2016-2024) and its operational plan were endorsed by the Council of Ministers providing for institution of three programs intended for children. However, the remodelling of the programs has not yet happened due to the delay in the approval of the decree | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy
Existence of monitoring and evaluation mechanisms to follow up on social protection delivery/system

actual.value: 2017:No. UNICEF will be working with ILO and WFP in supporting MGCAS and INAS to put in place a monitoring system to track on progress and bottlenecks regarding implementation of social protection programmes
